results.title: River with a problem
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow, Guy Glover and Graham Parker
results.brief_description: A film on water pollution, using the Ottawa River as an example of what happens when a river is used as a dumping place for municipal and industrial waste. Color animation illustrates exactly what happens to river water as it becomes polluted. Engineers, health authorities and civic officials voice concern over this increasingly urgent problem.

results.title: River watch
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roger Morin and Sydney Newman
results.brief_description: The story of how the St. Lawrence River is kept open for navigation is told, mentioning the parts played by lighthouses, marker buoys and ice breakers.

results.title: River to cross
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and R.K. Neilson Baxter
results.brief_description: An account of preliminary experiments carried out by scientists and engineers on the Severn Bridge Project 1946-49. Aspects of the work covered include: testing of foundation soils; echo-sounding of river bed; risks involved in building a suspension bridge; testing of model bridges with covered and open sides; final wind tests for oscillation on 1/100 scale model of proposed bridge.

results.title: River Rhine
results.brief_description: The Rhine is studied in four sections - from the source to Basel, Basel to Bingen, Bingen to Bonn and from Bonn to the mouth at Europoort. The agriculture and industries of each section are shown, together with the use of the river for transportation. The recent building of the Grand Canal d’Alsace is also seen.

results.title: River people of Chad
results.creator_credit: Visual Education Centre (Germany) and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the film made by the Instutut fur Film und Bild, Munich. Contrasts the modern city of Fort Lamy with the villages of Chad, where men, women and children use primitive tools for farming, fishing and cooking in a communal environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Visual Education Centre (Germany) and Institut für Film und Bild

results.title: River of wood
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Raymond Garceau
results.brief_description: In words and music, this film brings to the screen a great seasonal event of the Quebec spruce forests - the log drive. A ballad singer comments musically on this annual spectacle. Water-borne, the vast aggregation of logs moves downstream, spurred by dynamite and sharp-tipped cant hooks, tossed and twirled by the boots of leaping men. An abridged version of Log Drive (Title Code 006435).
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Raymond Garceau

results.title: River of steel
results.creator_credit: W H Larkin Cartoon Studio, Film Producers Guild and Peter Sachs
results.brief_description: A short cartoon summary of steel making followed by a humorous glimpse of a world suddenly deprived of its steel. A rhyming commentary guides through the processing of the steel, which is conveyed pictorially by bold attempts to combine the utilitarian approach of the drawing office and the artistic licence of the abstract painter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W H Larkin Cartoon Studio, Film Producers Guild and Peter Sachs

results.title: River of life
results.creator_credit: Independent Artists (GB), Ralph Keene and John Taylor
results.brief_description: Changing moods of the Welsh River Usk followed through the seasons of the year. Delicate camera-work reveals activities, rare to the naked eye, of species living in and around the river - the microscopic diatoms and leeches, insects, birds and fish - all contributing to the intricate society of the river’s life.

results.title: River of hope
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India and M. Bhavnani
results.brief_description: The Damodar Valley Project. The Damodar River in Dihar is known as the River of Sorrow; during the monsoon its floods cause death and destruction on a gigantic scale. The Damodar Valley Project is combating this with a series of dams on the river and its tributaries, and a barrage across the confluence of the Damodar and the Barakar Rivers.

results.title: River of diamonds
results.creator_credit: Films of Africa, J. Blake Dalrymple and Antony Thomas
results.brief_description: Gives the colorful history of the Orange River, lifeblood of half of South Africa’s cities in the east and its farms in the west. We see the mountains where the river rises, the farms and cities along its course, with the dams and tunnels now changing its face. Diamond mining has been the major industry since diamonds were discovered in 1866; now underwater drilling has commenced where the Orange enters the sea.
